Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2013 12:08PM Lynbeechwood wrote: oh my gosh-- so I think your saying that someone will talk to me before I leave about any results the radiologist sees good or bad? I just have no one to ask and suddenly my appointment is tomorrow. I am second guessing everything now- like if there is a problem how long has it been there? Will they tell me my birad score without me asking or do you need to ask?
Posts.Title: Diagnostic mammo -- please talk to me.. Lynbeechwood awb

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2013 06:12PM Lynbeechwood wrote: friends- I am out if the appointment driving home! The mammogram was taken and the tech said "the radiologist would like to do the ultrasound" so I was escorted to another waiting room with other women waiting in gowns- some were crying quietly. After about almost 2 hours the ultrasound tech came and got me- she was very kind- she did her scan quickly- told me to get dressed and that she would show the radiologist . I got dressed. And prayed again. The ultrasound tech came back in and said the radiologist said everything looks good - b9 both mammo an ultrasound. I literally asked if I could hug her and I did. I can't thank you all enough for the support and prayers. I am going to look into the mri/mbi because I do have dense breasts. Thank you for your love. Traci
Posts.Title: Diagnostic mammo -- please talk to me.. Lynbeechwood awb

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2013 12:37PM Lynbeechwood wrote: ok thank you so much for your time and knowledge- I really appreciate it so much! I will let you know how I make out tomorrow- my appointment is at 2 pm central time.

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2013 01:51PM Lynbeechwood wrote: ok well I picked up my last mammogram report for my appointment tomorrow and this is what it reads: Digital screening mamma interpreted with computer aided detection. Tissue density is heterogeneously dense. Views of breasts show no mass or malignant calcifications. There is no adverse change in appearance of breast parenchyma since 02/12. Bi-rads category 1- negative Ok so please let's pray that tomorrow's diagnostic mammo only shows the same!

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2013 02:58PM Lynbeechwood wrote: well I am here in the waiting room totally a wreck on the inside- I have now taken one whole anti anxiety pill- which I have not done in months-- I feel like I could vomit. I'm sorry to be so dramatic- I'm so scared- I just want to drive home.i haven't been called in yet- they are running behind with mammos. I see so many women here of all ages- I absolutely hate this for every one. I know I'm trying to be brave- but I can feel my heartbeat in my neck! Please say a pray for me- thank you!

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2013 07:37PM Lynbeechwood wrote: just wanted to say that I have been following Benny's posts since the beginning- I have a personal tie to breast cancer after losing my mom in the 90's to this disease- and have had some scares myself. I found this board by accident. I have been touched by Benny's posts and updates about her and diamond caring for each other- egging each other on- and just silently communicating love to each other as animals and humans do. I send my love and prayers on to Benny and hope that she finds comfort in the love she shared with diamond.
